lead_paragraph: The Colorado Rapids acquired Christian Gómez, one of the top scorers in Major League Soccer, from D.C. United for a first-round pick in the 2009 SuperDraft and future considerations. The Rapids signed Gómez to a two-year deal worth about $400,000 a season. Colorado finished second-to-last in scoring last season, averaging less than a goal a game. The 33-year-old Gómez, who was the league’s most valuable player in 2006, ranks first in the league since 2005 with 99 points, and is second during that time in goals (35) and assists (29).
